bio:treatment.discussion: As circumscribed here, Talinum is a primarily Old World genus with only two species found in North America. Other North American species that usually have been included in Talinum are recognized here under Phemeranthus (which see for discussion).

references.reference: Poellnitz, K. von. 1934. Monographie der Gattung Talinum Adans. Repert. Spec. Nov. Regni Veg. 35: 1–32.
Wilson, P. 1932d. Talinum. In: N. L. Britton et al., eds. 1905+. North American Flora.... 47+ vols. New York. Vol. 21, pp. 280–289.

key_statement.description: Inflorescences racem ose or cymose; pedicels triquetrous, distinctly thicker distally; petals 7mm or longer; stigma 1, 3-lobed
Inflorescences paniculate; pedicels terete, ± uniformly slender; petals 6 mm or shorter;stigmas 3, linear
